duties_responsibilities.duty: Screen, evaluate, and provide comprehensive assistance to victims of spouse/intimate partner abuse and non-offending parents or caregivers of child abuse.
Coordinate with FAP case manager, law enforcement, and/or sponsoring command to develop and implement plans for victim safety.
Conduct support groups for Child Abuse and Domestic Abuse victims and evaluate their needs, establishing individualized safety plans and making referrals to other helping agencies.
Advocate for the interests and safety of the victim in legal and investigative settings, reporting all suspected child abuse or neglect cases to proper authorities.
Maintain a cooperative working relationship with medical treatment facilities, Military Police, NCIS, and Unit Commanders.
Assist in the establishment and implementation of local policies and directives pertaining to the Family Advocacy Victim Advocate Program.
Coordinate and conduct education and awareness programs related to child abuse prevention, domestic violence prevention, and teen dating violence awareness.
Network with civilian resources and provide education and training to civilian providers of services on military resources and regulations.
Conduct education classes for Family Support Groups and the community on the prevention of domestic abuse.
Maintain victim advocacy notes and provide input to determine program effectiveness.
Perform other assigned duties related to victim advocacy.

education_certification.credential: Baccalaureate degree in counseling, education, psychology, or related behavioral sciences. Basic Advocate Credential with the designation as a Comprehensive Intervention Specialist, as approved by NACP/NOVA.
